About the translation of "Jukutou", it's translated as "head teacher" (rega=
rding Sakamoto) 
in the PMK anime and  "head of the school" in the PMK mang=
a.  In "Shinsengumi : the 
Shogun's Last Samurai Corps" by Romulus Hillsbor=
ough, it's also written "Okita Soji: genius 
swordsman, head of the Shieika=
n..."

I've decided to keep "Head Coach (Jukutou) at the Shieikan" in the O=
kita article and use  
"Head Teacher (Jukutou) at the Shieikan" in the Yama=
nami article at Wikipedia.  I really 
would like to avoid translating "Juku=
tou" as "Head of School."

However, I'd have no objection if the SHQ decide=
d to use "head of the school". (Just don't 
use "assistant instructor", ple=
ase.)

~Seven
